title: account banned when i haven't played for over a year on it
body: I've come back to play my account to find out it's banned for third party use but i've not played it for over a year and cant submit a ticket because i can't remember the date it was created nor can i find it anywhere, so would love someone from riot to help me out with this matter.

replies.body:
Sounds like the account was compromised and the intruder used third-party cheats and got the account banned sometime while you weren't playing.

The account recovery ticket is basically the only way to recover such an account, but it sounds like you're having trouble with the questions.

You don't have to give exact answers, the more exact the better of course, but if you can only answer in general terms it's still helpful, you'll just have to answer more of the questions overall for support to be confident you are the original owner of the account.

You can also offer more information than what is explicitly asked for. Any information that is unique to the account *but not visible on it* in any way is useful in determining original ownership. The closer the information is to the accounts creation date (i.e the older it is) the better.

So for example, if you know you purchased x skin the day it came out x years ago, that's helpful information. A list of skins you own (which is something a lot of people actually send in) **is not helpful**, because anyone with access to the account can see that and it is therefore useless for identifying you as the original owner.

Other things you can add that would be helpful:

1. Any RP purchase receipts you still have (that are from well before the compromise) 
2. Any particular IP purchases you remember making (for example if you bought x champ(s) at their 7800 release price instead of the 6300)
3. Any relevant dates that would be trackable like if you have a screenshot of the first time you hit Honour 5 or Mastery 7 on a champion, or Gold etc, etc.
